page.title: 18Recent History-St.Ippolyts
page.content:
An account of changes over the last 10 years, from an interview with Mrs Penny Walker:
CHURCH: In July 1979 the Freehold of the Priest was suspended,ie the Bishop was free to terminate the living of the Priest at short notice.In August 1981 this was asked to be lifted as the then Vicar in Charge-Robert Law- was unhappy about his unsure position. The Bishop refused. In October 1984 the P.C.C. asked again that the suspension be lifted as the new Vicar Keith Allison was also feeling insecure.In December/January the suspension of the Benefice was lifted and in early May the Vicar was installed as Vicar of the Freehold. ROADS AND CONSTRUCTION: In the 1950's reference was first made to an East- (contd)
